sub_title: Grants & Development Manager (East Africa) at Fauna & Flora International
summary:
International Development professional with over 5 years’ experience in grant management, project management, and fundraising with international NGOs and consultancies in the UK and the Netherlands. Projects worked on have included a range of geographies and thematic areas, primarily: education, gender equality, health, livelihoods, nutrition, WASH, and wildlife conservation in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia.

Educational qualifications in Zoology, Environmental Development, and International Development. Research experience in human-wildlife conflict in northern Botswana.

certifications.name: SDG Academy: Age of Sustainable Development, Jeffrey Sachs

profile_positions.description:
East Africa (Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, South Sudan) fund management responsibilities for a variety of statuatory donors and grants (mainly BlueAction Fund, DEFRA/Darwin Initiative, US Fish & Wildlife), including:

Collaborating with relevant staff members, partners and consultants to ensure the smooth start up, integration and delivery of fund activities against the workplan, targets and budgets, coordinating the inputs of regional and cross-cutting teams.

Technical and financial report writing and editing, coordinating the inputs of team members, cross-cutting teams, specialists and partners, ensuring accurate and timely reports as per Fauna & Flora and donor requirements.

Facilitate development of funding proposals (technical and financial) that meet the outcomes and objectives of Fauna & Flora’s portfolio of work in East Africa, engaging relevant Africa programme staff and cross-cutting team members.

Additional varied responsibilities include:
- Contracting
- Internal and external proposal/grant compliance
- Fund management and financial forecasting
- Procurement (material and service)
- Recruitment and line management
- International travel to project sites and partners
profile_positions.title: Grants & Development Manager (East Africa)

profile_positions.description:
Managed a portfolio of 23 FCDO-funded UK Aid Match grants in 13 African (Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Liberia, Malawi, Mozambique, Nigeria, Sierra Leone, South Sudan, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia & Zimbabwe) and 4 Asian (Bangladesh, Laos, Nepal & Pakistan) countries, with a cumulative value of over £40 million.

Grant management from grant set-up to grant closure, developing a strong understanding of project objectives and supporting the grant holder to improve project performance. Projects covered a range of thematic areas, primarily education, gender equality, health, livelihoods, nutrition, WASH, and wildlife conservation.

Analysed quarterly and annual performance reports, identifying contextual and technical issues that prevented delivery, collaborating with grant holders and internal teams to resolve issues. Identified and monitored key risks.

Maintained oversight of financial and contractual compliance of grants, working closely with other internal compliance teams. Oversaw the scoring and payment process for grant holder reports, ensuring internal timelines are met.

Identified lessons learned and examples of better practice within the grants to share across the portfolio, to develop capacity building activities for grant holders and to provide inputs to the communications team.

Maintained project management tools and online systems and contributed to the development and review of new fund management tools, processes and information.
profile_positions.title: Performance and Risk Manager (UK Aid Match)

profile_positions.description:
Supported in overseeing, monitoring, and administering the portfolio of FCDO UK Aid Direct & Match grant holders, including M&E reports and project closures.

Maintained, updated, and monitored project tracking tools to ensure grant holder compliance. Ensured grant holder contracting and document management was complete and accurate. 

Supported and facilitated grant holder meetings, events, and corresponding materials. Supported with data analysis and research to respond to queries from FCDO and external parties.

Supported the preparation and management of new grant calls and the procurement process of external consultants. Reviewed and processed invoices.

Reviewed, revised, and improved processes, project templates, performance and quality assurance mechanisms with the management team.
profile_positions.title: Grants Officer (UK Aid Funds)

profile_positions.description:
Managed department’s annual budget and ensured that a comprehensive set of accounts was prepared and reviewed on a monthly basis and reported to budget holders, resulting in departmental cost recoveries.

Assisted the fundraising efforts of the GAAC department through donor mappings and proposal development, leading to securing two successful advocacy contracts and projects.

Provided project and administrative support to two external network organisations hosted by HelpAge International - GAROP (Global Alliance for the Rights of Older People) and CommonAge (Commonwealth Association for the Ageing).

Coordinated the GAAC department’s 2020-2022 bi-annual planning and reporting commitments and any additional ad-hoc departmental planning and progress reporting.

Managed donor and partner contracts, including ensuring compliance to contractual terms and associated policies, in line with HelpAge’s contract and partnership management procedures.
profile_positions.title: Global Ageing, Advocacy and Campaigns (GAAC) Programme Officer

profile_positions.description:
Provided support to the International Programme department, across all teams (Development, Humanitarian, Monitoring Accountability Evaluation and Learning), whilst part-time studying for a master’s in International Development.

Institutional fundraising. Actively contributed to proposal development and administration for 7- and 8-figure grants from the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Implemented evaluations on the inter-departmental communication and collaboration system and 'Learning Organisation' project, leading to significant changes by Senior Management.

Produced funding strategy document cross-referencing priority countries and thematic areas for StC Netherlands, implementation Country Offices and key institutional donors (Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, ECHO & DEVCO).
profile_positions.title: Project Support Officer

profile_positions.description:
Grant prospecting, writing and management support across a variety of donors (institutional, corporate, trusts and foundations) and partner organisations.

Key proposal content contribution for grants from Netherlands Enterprise Agency, The Hershey Company, Rabobank Foundation, COMO Foundation, Echidna Giving and the Kahane Foundation.

Facilitated proposal development process for a 7-figure 'Sustainable Development Goal' public-private-NGO partnership, to contribute towards SDGs 2 (ending hunger) and 8 (decent jobs and economic growth).
profile_positions.title: Resource Mobilisation Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Activated and monitored programmatic digital marketing campaigns for Nestle, across numerous brands and platforms.

Analysed large data sets (including financial data) in real-time to optimise campaign performance and meet a range of KPIs and pre-set targets.

Reported campaign performance to internal teams, clients and partner organisations.

Built and maintained relationships with publishers and tech companies.
profile_positions.title: Activation Executive
